reviewText: I remember seeing the Treasure of Atlantis on TV in Australia and it intrigued me. I was pleased to find it released on DVD - finally. I thought that the set was quite well produced but had a quaint perhaps early teenager presentation about them. There wasn't the drama that I have associated with the Indiana Jones movies. I am not sure if people would like this approach.The MacGyver TV series were also interesting but I have not gone to the expense of buying them - yet.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Of course, some of the special effects are cheesy, but hey, if you're a MacGyver fan, then these are great. "Lost Treasure of Atlantis" felt more like an Indiana Jones spinoff than anything, and it didn't have as much MacGyver-ing as I expected, but I still like it. Why not? It's Richard Dean Anderson! "Trail to Doomsday" had a deeper plot and felt a little more like the TV show (at least in my opinion). If you're not a fan of the TV show, then you'll probably find these too corny for a good rating. But if you're a fan like I am, then this set is a great addition to the collection.
Title: N/A

reviewText: When purchasing a series of TV shows it is important to have all the years, plus the individual movies, that was produced while it was in production.  These movies were brought out during the run of this show's 7 year production, and therefore a necessity to own if I wanted the entire production.I like the continuity of this series stories, and their interaction within it's 7 year run.I would recommend this product to any serious MacGyver fan, or anyone that appreciates watching mysteries and how the "hero" reasons out the solution to different complex problems.
summary: The movies that was produced during the 7 year run of this series.

reviewText: AS MUCH AS I LIKE AND APPRECIATE THE "MACGYVER SERIES" I JUST DON'T REMEMBER EITHER ONE OF THESE MOVIES. WHEN I PUT OUT THE QUESTION: DOES ANYONE KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT A MOVIE THAT WAS MADE AFTER THE SERIES, WHEN THESE TWO MOVIES BECAME AVAILABLE, I THOUGHT ONE OF THEM WOULD HAVE BEEN THE ONE I REMEMBER SEEING. I DON'T RECALL SEEING EITHER ONE OF THESE. JUST LIKE WITH SOME OF THE OTHER VIEWERS AND PURCHASERS. I TOO, WAS VERY DISAPPOINTED. THEY WEREN'T BAD, AS FAR AS SOME MILD ENTERTAINMENT GOES. HOWEVER, CALL ME CRAZY BUT I THINK THERE MAY BE SOME MISSING EPISODES FLOATING AROUND OR EVEN A MOVIE OR TWO STILL OUT THERE. SO LET ME TRY THIS AGAIN, DOES ANYONE HAVE A CLUE AS TO ANY POSSIBLE MISSING EPISODES OR MOVIE/S THAT MAY HAVE BEEN SEEN JUST NOT INCLUDED IN ANY OF THE RELEASE SEASONS OR AS PART OF THE TV MOVIES THAT WERE RELEASED, COULD YOU LET THE OTHER FANS KNOW! ONE MORE THING, I AM STILL MYSTIFIED WHY I DON'T RECALL HARDLY ANY OF THE EARLIER EPISODES BECAUSE THE EARLIER ONES WERE THE ONES I MOSTLY SAW. I MOSTLY WATCHED "MACGYVER" DURING PROBABLY THE FIRST THREE SEASONS, THEN I LOST TRACK OF THE SHOW AND DIDN'T WATCH MUCH OF IT UNTIL CLOSER TO THE END OF THE SERIES. THEN ONE DAY I CAUGHT A PART OF A MACGYVER MOVIE THAT WAS ON. I DON'T RECALL THE TITLE. SO IF ANYONE KNOW WHAT I'M REFERRING TO OR TALKING ABOUT WOULD YOU LET ME KNOW. THANKS IN ADVANCE.
summary: MACGYVER: THE TV MOVIES: I'M NOT SURE I SAW EITHER ONE OF THESE

reviewText: MacGyver: The TV MoviesWhat better way of finishing off a macgyver collection than by these movies?  Should we have another macgyver with Murdoc in it?  For some people this bored the pants off of them.  I know as I had a party with us watching only the episodes with Macgyver and Murdoc in it.  How bout Pete who is in more than 100 episodes or Jack who is in 14 episodes?One of my favourite episodes was Macgyver on a treasure hunt.  And yes you get 90 minutes of macgyver on a treasure hunt in 'The treasure of Lost Atlantis'.The other movie is just as good or nearly as good.  You see, in the next movie, Macgyver is on the run, as he gets framed for a crime he didn't commit.  Sorta like the movie the Fugitive or the 2nd season of Prison break.  So you get 90 minutes of him on the run from the police which is sorta unique.You'll love this even more if like me you have an interest in economics or politics.  In this movie their is a 1 or 2 minute debate, about whether communism is real, if their are a few people who fund communism, making a profit from the people at the bottom.  Sorta like the book, "The creature from Jekyll Island".So yes, I was very thrilled with these movies, and wasn't disappointed at all.  And neither will those, who I bored the pants off of at my Macgyver vs Murdoc party.
summary: Macgyver fan's perfect way of completing a collection

reviewText: We MacGyver fans waited patiently for nearly three years for the separate dvd release of the two MacGyver tv movies from back in 1994.........the wait was well worth it !  The final Season 7 of the MacGyver tv series was released back in 2007,  and the the tv movies were only available in the series boxset released sometime later.......thanks to  Paramount  for the separate release of the MacGyver tv movies on a single, separate dvd .....the movies are as good as the tv series episodes !

reviewText: MacGyver's at it again but in these made for T.V. movies they could have been episodes. These are drawn out. reviewText: I'm one of the many fans who spent my precious $$$ to get the seperated season sets without give in to paramount's blackmail to get also the complete series box set JUST TO HAVE THE TV MOVIES cause until now that was the only way to have the movies but instead i waited and waited and waited and waited...etc....UNTIL FINALLY "Macrubber" or something like that did the miracle and now paramount finally is releasing those two movies seperately FOR ALL OF US WHO WAITED AND WAITED AND DID NOT SPEND $130 JUST FOR TWO TV MOVIES...So for you who spend your $$$ to get the complete series just for the two movies i'm sorry but u lost.All the rest u won.
